ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Processing Disorder (APD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient scored outside two standard deviations on multiple auditory processing tests (WIN, ATTR, LiSN-S) despite normal peripheral hearing sensitivity.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) / Mild Traumatic Brain Injury (mTBI)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of blast exposures and confirmed mTBI; symptoms mimic APD, and functional improvements were attributed largely to mental health counseling.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess peripheral hearing sensitivity given reports of hearing loss and tinnitus.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities in quiet.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and rule out retrocochlear pathology.
To quantify the self-perceived functional hearing handicap.
To investigate reported dizziness and imbalance.
To assess speech recognition in noise as part of the APD battery.
To measure temporal resolution (gap detection) as part of the APD battery.
To assess auditory stream segregation and spatial processing skills.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing sensitivity was essentially normal with only slight low-frequency loss, and middle ear function was normal. However, the patient reported a severe self-perceived hearing handicap inconsistent with the peripheral results.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral slight hearing loss at 250-1000 Hz, rising to within normal limits at 2000-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild SRT loss in the right ear (20 dB HL), slight in the left (17 dB HL); Word Recognition Scores 100% bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal middle ear function bilaterally (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes within normal limits; reflex decay negative.

tests.name: Hearing Handicap Inventory for Adults (HHIA-S)
tests.result_summary: Score of 28, indicating severe self-perceived hearing handicap.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Vestibular testing was normal. Auditory processing evaluation revealed significant deficits in speech-in-noise performance, temporal resolution, and spatial processing, meeting criteria for APD.

tests.name: Words-in-Noise (WIN) test
tests.result_summary: 18.8 dB SNR, indicating severe SNR loss (Norm: <= 6.0 dB SNR).

tests.name: Adaptive Test of Temporal Resolution (ATTR)
tests.result_summary: Gap detection threshold 54.5 msec, indicating poor temporal resolution (Norm: 3.0 msec).

tests.name: Listening in Spatialized Noise (LiSN-S)
tests.result_summary: Deficits in spatial and talker cues; Low-cue SRT 14.6 dB, High-cue SRT 14.2 dB.

proposed_items: FM system trial (Phonak iSense with ZoomLink+ or SmartLink+)
Hearing conservation strategies (disposable ear plugs for excessive noise)
counseling_actions: Communication strategies (facing speaker, reducing background noise, preferential seating)
Counseling on hyperacusis and tinnitus management
Explanation of APD results and their impact on listening in noise

escalation.rationale_short: To address PTSD symptoms which may be exacerbating or mimicking auditory processing deficits.

follow_up_plan.objective: Re-evaluation of auditory processing skills and review of functional goals (COSI) following counseling and therapy.

expected_outcome: Words-in-Noise (WIN) test: 15.6 dB SNR (severe SNR loss), showing improvement from baseline but remaining abnormal.
Adaptive Test of Temporal Resolution (ATTR): Gap detection threshold 15.5 msec, significantly improved from baseline but still abnormal.
Listening in Spatialized Noise (LiSN-S): Low-cue SRT 10.6 dB, High-cue SRT 8.2 dB, Talker Advantage 1.4 dB, Spatial Advantage 5.6 dB; improved scores but still below normal limits.
Patient reported significantly reduced anxiety and avoidance behaviors in social situations.
Patient found the FM system and Brain Fitness Program helpful and reported significant improvements in daily quality of life.
